Adjust downforce to maximize top speed on straights.
Keep an eye on tyre wear during qualifying; softer compounds wear faster.
Avoid overheating brakes; they can cause tyre degradation.
Optimize braking points on high-downforce corners for better lap times.
Track temperature affects tyre wear; monitor and adjust strategies accordingly.
Practice tyre management to maintain performance over a stint.
Reduce fuel load for qualifying laps to improve lap time.
Monitor crosswinds on open sections; they can destabilize the car.
Balance fuel load and tyre strategy for optimal lap times.
Lower fuel consumption by reducing full-throttle usage on shorter circuits.
For circuits with fewer corners, prioritize top speed over cornering.
Use higher downforce for better grip on twisty circuits.
Soft compounds provide quicker grip but require careful management.
For circuits with multiple DRS zones, focus on exit speed from corners.
High-speed circuits require balanced aerodynamics for stability.
